content.description: Start with left on crimp and right hand/heel hook match. The crux is making the first two moves. Good crimps, just maybe too small for a newbie. After the crimps, reach for the huge jugs and make an easy top-out.
content.location: Relatively in the center of the area. Can be identified by the small roof on the side away from you as you approach.

content.description:
Start on same knobs and low insecure heel hook as "Beneath the Bow". Make a tricky body tension move to a bad thumb-pinch sloper. Use intermediates to and bring feet up to get to big undercling in order to set up for the crux to the hidden jugs several feet up. 

 Good jug over the lip. Careful topping out on this one.
content.location: Same boulder as Beneath the Bow. Just climb the relatively blank vertical face left of the arete.

content.description: Start on two small knobs and make a big move to the eye socket, match, turn it unto a undercling and figure out how to go underneath the small roof with some tricky toe/heel hook beta  and then up the vertical face on the other side using the arete and good crimps.
content.location: Relatively easy to find. There is only a handful of boulders in the section of the woods.

content.description: Much shadier than on the tracks for obvious reasons. Potential for some cool problems.
